daycare_capacity.long_description: Summed capacity (seats) of all day care providers within the region, according to the Virginia Department of Social Services.
daycare_capacity.statement: There are {value} day care seats in {region_name}.

daycare_min_drivetime.short_description: Minutes to the nearest day care provider.
daycare_min_drivetime.long_description: Time (minutes) to drive to the nearest day care provider of any type. Times are calculated using the Open Source Routing Machine, from block group centroids to each provider. Times for higher geolayers are averaged across block groups.
daycare_min_drivetime.statement: It takes {value} to drive to the nearest day care provider in {region_name}.

daycare_ratio{category}.short_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children {category}.
daycare_ratio{category}.long_description: Number of day care seats per 1,000 children {category}, as calculated within floating catchment areas. Catchment area ratios are based on the population of children {category.statement} within block groups (as estimated in the American Community Survey), capacity of eligible day care providers (as reported by the Virginia Department of Social Services), and travel times between block group centroids and day care locations (as calculated with the Open Source Routing Machine). Catchment areas are weighted by travel time with a Gaussian function with scale of 18, which are normalized for each consumer (for a 3-step floating catchment area), as calculated by the catchment R package.
daycare_ratio{category}.statement: There are {value} day care seats per 1,000 children {category} in {region_name}.

all.description: under 15 years of age, which accept at least ages 4 to 10

_over_4.description: between 5 and 14 years of age, which accept at least some ages over 4
_over_4.long_name: Between 5 and 14, With Minimal Accepted Age Over 4

_under_10.description: under 10 years of age, which accept at least some ages under 10
_under_10.long_name: Under 10, With Maximal Accepted Age Under 10

wan12.title: A three-step floating catchment area method for analyzing spatial access to health services
wan12.journal: International Journal of Geographical Information Science

bii21.author: Biocomplexity Institute and Initiative

bennett11.title: Educational Inequailty in the United States: Methodology and Historical Estimates of Education Gini Coefficients
bennett11.journal: Center for College Affordability and Productivity

schools_2year_{category.name}.short_description: Number of 2-year schools{category} per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
schools_2year_{category.name}.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates{category} per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) qualifying 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
schools_2year_{category.name}.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools{category} per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

with_biomedical_program.long_description: with biomedical programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 26)

with_science_program.long_description: with science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 41)

with_physical_program.long_description: with science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 40)

with_computer_program.long_description: with science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 11)

with_engineering_program.long_description: with science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 14 or 15)

schools_under2year.short_description: Number of <2-year schools per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
schools_under2year.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) <2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
schools_under2year.statement: There are {value} <2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {region_name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

schools_{variant.name}_min_drivetime.short_description: Drive time to the nearest {variant} schools.
schools_{variant.name}_min_drivetime.long_description: Minimal drive time to a schools authorized to award {variant} from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
schools_{variant.name}_min_drivetime.statement: It takes {value} to drive to the nearest {variant} school from {region_name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

2year.long_description: Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates

under2year.long_description: certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years

acs_postsecondary_{variant}.long_description: {variant} who reported any postsecondary education, according to the U.S. Census American Community Survey 5-year estimates.

sources.name: U.S. Census, American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B06009, via the API

{variant.name}_read_pass_rate.long_name: {variant} percentage of 3rd graders passing reading test
{variant.name}_read_pass_rate.short_description: {variant} percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
{variant.name}_read_pass_rate.long_description: {variant} percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test. The {variant.name} is calculated across schools in the region.

sources.name: Virginia Department of Education
sources.location: Data & Reports > Statistics & Reports > SOL Test Pass Rates & Other Results

average_years_schooling_{category.name}.short_description: Average years of schooling among {category} age 25 and over.
average_years_schooling_{category.name}.long_description: Average years of schooling among {category} age 25 and over. This is calculated by averaging across the education attainment variables (e.g., number of people who indicated their highest level of education is a Bachelor's degree), which are multiplied by the number of years associated with each level of education (e.g., a Bachelor's degree is associate with 16 years; as listed in Bennett, 2011, Table 1).

sources.name: U.S. Census, American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B15002, via the API

average_years_schooling_{category.name}.statement: {category.long_name} in {region_name} have {value} years of schooling on average.

EduGini{category.name}.short_description: Education Gini{category}; relative distribution of education attainment.
EduGini{category.name}.long_description: A measure of the relative distribution of education attainment{category}, ranging from 0 to 1, where 0 means perfectly equal education attainment: \[\mathrm{EduGini_{t}} = (\mu_{t})^{-1}\sum_{i=2}^{n_{t}}\sum_{j=1}^{i-1}p_{t,i}|y_{t,i}-y_{t,j}|p_{t,j}\] Where t is the year, mu is average years of schooling, p is the percentage of the population, y is the number of years associated with each level of attainment, and n is the number of such levels. This is calculated using the years of schooling variable, and the same single education-level variables (as percentages) that go into the average.
EduGini{category.name}.statement: Education attainment equality{category} in {region_name} is {value} (0 = perfect).

sources.name: U.S. Census, American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B15002, via the API

average_years_schooling.long_description: The Education Index measures the average education level achieved by the adult population in an area. This is based on the average years of schooling in an area. The calculation used to calculate the index can be found in (Bennett, D.L. Educational Inequailty in the United States: Methodology and Historical Estimates of Education Gini Coefficients. Econ. Modeling Microeconom. Stud. Health 2001). Higher educational attainment has been shown to have positive impacts on economic earning and positive health outcomes.
average_years_schooling.statement: {value} is the avg yrs of schooling in {features.name}.
